EY Global Delivery Services (GDS) is a dynamic and truly global delivery network. We work across six locations – Argentina, China, India, the Philippines, Poland, and the UK – and with teams from all EY service lines, geographies, and sectors, playing a vital role in the delivery of the EY growth strategy. From accountants to coders to advisory consultants, we offer a wide variety of fulfilling career opportunities that span all business disciplines. In GDS, you will collaborate with EY teams on exciting projects and work with well-known brands from across the globe. We’ll introduce you to an ever-expanding ecosystem of people, learning, skills, and insights that will stay with you throughout your career.
Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.

EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

In GDS, you will collaborate with EY teams on exciting projects and work with well-known brands from across the globe. We’ll introduce you to an ever-expanding ecosystem of people, learning, skills, and insights that will stay with you throughout your career.

Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

Come create the technology that helps the world act together

Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people’s lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.

We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work.

The team you’ll part of

As Nokia's growth engine, we create value for communication service providers and enterprise customers by leading the transition to cloud-native software and as-a-service delivery models. Our inclusive team of dreamers, doers and disruptors push the limits from impossible to possible.

You will part of the core team that deploys/automates our products from Business Applications Portfolio. Your team will be responsible to constantly innovate and ease deployments through automation & adopt to customer requirements using latest cutting-edge technologies and cloud native solutions.

This is an exciting opportunity with a fun team that values trust and autonomy. You will be a part of a team whose objectives are to deliver in an environment where openness, trust and autonomy are encouraged, each team member selects the tasks to work on and exchanges daily with his/her team mates on the progress and challenges.

What you will learn and contribute to

As a DevOps Engineer, you will support in Designing DevOps architecture, Containerization technologies in Cloud Native architecture.
Setup, administration, support on Jenkins and pipeline groovy scripts and libraries for CI/CD as part of AGILE development.
Containerized solution for product builds using Dockers.
Artifactory (Jfrog) usage for both incoming and outgoing build artifacts

Your skills and experience

Mandatory skills:
Bachelor of Engineering Degree and minimum 10 years’ experience
A strong individual contributor with hands on experience in build, tools, and DevOps area
Devops administration and configuration, automation tools, Best Practices.
Tools: Jenkins, Git, JIRA, Artifactory, Maven
Understanding of setting up Build tools, static code analysis, Code coverage
Package and Product build, integration, Delivery experience
Experience with Operating System Platform – Windows and Unix environment
Good in Shell scripting, Perl, Python
Experience in working with Kubernetes
Virtualization, Containerization
Hands-on experience in Deployment automation, Ansible, Helm scripting
Networking understanding, Maintenance and Troubleshooting
Maintenance and Troubleshooting experience, Performance analysis and recommendation about DevOps setup.

Desired skills:
Any cloud environments like AWS, GCP, Tanzu etc.
Agile, DevOps, Scrum, Kanban Methodologies
Exposure to Streaming Technologies
Good communication skills
‘Getting things done’ and hands-on mentality

What we offer

Nokia offers flexible and hybrid working schemes, continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.

Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer
Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality:
One of the World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere
Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg
Workplace Pride Global Benchmark

At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people.

Company Description

About Us:
PromptCloud is a Data as a Service company that helps businesses harness the power of data. Our technology fuels some of the most interesting big data projects in the world. Job Description

Devops Engineer

About Us:
PromptCloud is a Data as a Service company that helps businesses harness the power of data. Our technology fuels some of the most interesting big data projects in the world. We are a small bunch of people working towards shaping the imminent data-driven future by solving some of its fundamental and toughest challenges.

The PromptCloud experience is about striving to become the best version of ourselves holistically, an experience that lasts a lifetime. We tend to have clear growth paths for every role and level in the org so the learning never stops. We believe in a work-life blend, and hence encourage responsible flexibility, which is particularly important in a fully remote setup we have. We trust our people with the impact they can create, and let them choose how they want to do so. We are on a mission to put reliable data at the heart of every business to fuel success and intend to transform the lives we touch (of our customers and our people) while on this journey.

What does this role entail?
From designing a distributed system, improving the architecture for scale, optimizing the performance, provisioning the servers, monitoring the metrics, and troubleshooting the bugs, which means own the entire infrastructure.

Responsibilities:
Work with product delivery teams to identify architectural issues and ensure timely and smooth delivery of features into operations.
Build and maintain models for growth and capacity planning Administration of production infrastructure.
Building automation to simplify system management,tech operations etc.
Own the day-to-day health, uptime, monitoring, and reliability of services and server infrastructure Deployment, support and monitoring of new platforms and application stacks.
Participate in new technology evaluation, design and development of highly scalable distributed systems and pipelines
You’ll fit in, if
You want to work on:
Designing and deploying large scale systems, distributed infrastructure systems
Maintaining and improving service-oriented architecture and web services
Adapt monitoring for an increasingly dynamic environment of servers and services.
You have experience in:
1+ years of experience in the related domains.
Experience with Unix/Linux systems with scripting experience in Shell and one of Perl Python or Ruby.
Strong knowledge of core protocols and tech such as: TCP/IP, HTTP, DNS, load balancers, database clusters Hands on Experience with Ansible.
Experience with management of high availability clusters of services in ELK,Redis, mysql cluster etc.
Capable of technical deep-dives into code, networking, systems.
Logging and Monitoring experience designing, deploying and running systems like Splunk, ELK, New Relic or other APM solutions
Bonus points if you have experience in:
Worked on any of these tools Selenium, GGR, Proxies, AWS, GCE, Jenkins, RabbitMq, Resque
Team handling and project management.

We are a 100% remote company and we strive to build a unique and thriving workplace where work is designed around people (and not the other way round). More details on PromptCloud’s culture and how we work can be found in the PC 2.0 Culture Handbook shared here - https://www.promptcloud.com/life-at-promptcloud.
Perks
An environment where each employee is celebrated.
A one-time home office setup allowance, monthly allowances for internet bills, child care allowance for new mothers/single parents.
Half-yearly performance appraisals
Flexible working hours
Competitive salary

Additional Information

To know more about this position you can reach me out on parvesh (at) promptcloud.com

We are looking for an experienced DevOps Engineer to solve complex problems and articulate in detail technical solutions that enable the business to scale and drive efficiency in its AWS environment. The ideal candidate must be able to identify problems, design processes, and technical solutions, and assist in driving projects to successful delivery. You must be analytical, self-driven, ready to operate in a fast-paced environment, and willing to do what it takes to get the job done. Your contributions will enable health systems and clinical laboratories to deliver personalized medicine based on an individual’s genomic profile.

About Pierian
Every year millions of people bet their lives on precision medicine. Pierian is on a mission to make sure that bet pays off. At Pierian we empower progressive health institutions and diagnostic laboratories to build world-class precision medicine programs. Our industry-leading molecular genomics technologies and expertise deliver the most integrated, trusted, and collaborative approach across the clinical care spectrum. From genomic sequencing and biomedical informatics in the laboratory to reporting and decision support at the patient’s bedside, we drive the adoption of genomics in clinical care and accelerate the fight against cancer and other diseases. For more information, visit www.pieriandx.com or @PierianDx on Twitter.

Provide technical engineering support to all phases of network development, operation, and management

Experience with MongoDB, AWS is required, and Postgres experience is a plus

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

The opportunity
You will be working to deliver a range of cloud infrastructure automation projects, often involving cloud migration solutions.

Your key responsibilities
Working knowledge of one or more public cloud platforms - GCP, Azure, AWS
Deploying IaaS and PaaS services on public cloud platforms using Compute, Application, Storage, Database, Kubernetes and serverless components.
Working on cloud design considerations and FinOps
Setup networking principles and protocols such as IP subnetting, routing, firewall rules, Virtual Private Cloud, LoadBalancer, DNS, CDN, etc.
Working in a modern scripting language (preferably Python) for automation of build tasks.
Creating Terraform/Terragrunt code for automated cloud service deployments
Setting up Application Architecture and Monitoring
Platform enablement and build, automation (Infrastructure as Code) and security controls
CI/CD with Jenkins and/or Ansible
Containerisation experience with Kubernetes and Docker
Perform root cause analysis for production errors

To qualify for the role, you must have
Experience working with AWS and/or Azure and/or GCP and a proven track record of building complex infrastructure programmatically with IaC tooling or vendor libraries
Strong scripting / programming skills in Python, Linux Shell
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and using test driven frameworks
Strong experience in container orchestration tools such as kubernetes
Experience with implementing and testing different cloud Services
Experience with Agile and DevOps concepts
Strong communication and written skills
Experience creating technical architecture documentation
Experience in Linux OS internals, administration and performance optimization.
Problem-solving attitude

Good to have
Cloud engineer/architect certifications in any of the public cloud platforms
Certified Kubernetes Admin (CKA)
Terraform certification

What we look for
Has successfully demonstrated domain of most skills and technologies during many relevant projects
Confidently uses most of the related skills and technologies, and maintains an in-depth knowledge of the area

What we offer
EY Global Delivery Services (GDS) is a dynamic and truly global delivery network. We work across six locations – Argentina, China, India, the Philippines, Poland and the UK – and with teams from all EY service lines, geographies and sectors, playing a vital role in the delivery of the EY growth strategy. From accountants to coders to advisory consultants, we offer a wide variety of fulfilling career opportunities that span all business disciplines. In GDS, you will collaborate with EY teams on exciting projects and work with well-known brands from across the globe. We’ll introduce you to an ever-expanding ecosystem of people, learning, skills and insights that will stay with you throughout your career.
Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

job title: Client Technology: Platform Engineering, DevOps Engineer
job description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

Our Team’s Culture: EY’s mission is to build a better working world and we can’t do it without the right people: exceptional people know for their thought leadership with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to work with the best, constantly learn and create positive change. In the CTPE (Client Technology Engineering) Team within the Client Technology (CT) organization, we use innovative and superior technology capabilities while maximizing efficiency to allow further investment in ongoing growth. Our evolving approach adopts the innovative and cultural approaches of technology leaders:
To build high performing and independent global teams, we value integrity, respect, collaboration and excellence
We foster continuous learning through purposeful and broad sharing of knowledge
We evolve and challenge teams by communicating in a respectful, direct and open manner
In pursuit of speed and flexibility, we focus on outcomes rather than rules
To foster creativity, we want work to be fun, exciting and rewarding
We automate the repeatable to ensure speed and quality
We exercise good judgement in balancing strategic goals with tactical needs

Essential Functions of the Job:
Collaborates with key stakeholders in developing and delivering the required solution.
Follows the industry best practices for developing and delivering Azure based solutions.
Enforces design and development governance structures, methodologies (architecture and engineering) and compliance activities to maintain regulatory compliance and enterprise standards
Strong analytical skills capable of assessing complex business requirements from real world scenarios and the ability to translate them solution delivery plans and deliverables.
Deep technical proficiency while the ability to keeping an eye on the bigger picture
Ability to identify, prioritize and weigh different options to determine a best solution
Contributing to technology standards

Skills Requirements:

From 4 -5 years plus of demonstrable enterprise level IT delivery experience
3-4 years of Experience - DevOps practices & techniques.
Approaches to source code management & control through Azure Dev Ops, Git/ GitHub and Cloud Orchestration tools.
Experience in Cloud Orchestration tool preferably ansible and Terraform.
Understanding of Azure platform including abstraction layers for automation.
Developer capabilities & relevant developer tools including ADO/Agile/ growth mindset.
Experience in Azure Kubernetes Administration and Docker Platform.
Experience in Azure AD and Identity Management Solution.
RBAC model & delegation rights including Azure application delivery (EWS & Graph API delegation & direct permissions models)
Good To Have - Understanding of Java and Spring Boot.
Knowledge of Camunda Workflows
Release & Deployment, Requirement Definition & Management
Programming/Software Development
Cloud (2-3 years) in an engineering role using service and hosting solutions such as private/public cloud IaaS, PaaS and SaaS platforms. Experience in engineer technical solutions for Microsoft-centric solutions based on industry standards using Azure IaaS, PaaS and SaaS capabilities, Linux. Nice to have Experience with any of the following: Azure ML services, Azure Stack, Azure AD

Scripting (2-3 years) – having knowledge and experience with Ansible, Microsoft PowerShell (required), and Linux shell scripting (preferred). Being able to understand and use best practices of completing tasks and finding solutions using existing or building new scripts to help automate today’s manual infrastructure and application tasks.
Configuration Management (2-3 years) – being able to develop recipes for new solutions to deploy consistent systems, enforce configurations and settings through configuration management systems like PowerShell DSC, Chef or Puppet.

Web Services, API, REST (1-2 years) – Understanding and having experience with leveraging web services (SOAP), different API endpoints including the usage of REST based APIs to be able to be able to build loosely coupled architectures and solutions that are quick to implement and are easy to monitor.

Networking (1-3 years) - Have a solid understanding of networking capabilities, including load balancers, web application firewalls, network access control lists (NACLs), security groups, routing, tracing, DNS resolution are key to building efficient and stable solutions that prevent business downtime and provide high availability capabilities.

Documentation (2-3 years) - Being able to create technical documents that provide insight into the design and implementation of a solution provides teams with the ability to effectively communicate their needs and requirements across the organization. The candidate has to be able to produce clear and concise architecture and design documentation that can assist his team and other peer groups in understanding of the built solutions. The candidate must also be able to communicate complex technical issues with sensitivity to diverse audiences and people with different level of technical understanding that range from entry level support teams, management, and technical engineering resources.

Operational Support awareness (2-3 years) – A good understanding of what it takes to support the deployed applications and solutions is key to providing great service to the end users. The candidate has to be able to put themselves into a position of understanding of their consumer pain points to be able to figure out creative ways not only to find quick workarounds but also analyze the root cause of the problem and come up with ideas of resolving them in the long term.

Source code management (1-3 years) – Familiarity with source control tools such as Git, Team Foundation Server (TFVC)/ ADO, and SVN are a big part of automation and compliance. Understanding how these tools are and could be used is key to not only provide the proper change control management to new versions of products that are being developed, but also to help provide consistency in deploying those products/solutions throughout environments using automation. Exposure to build CI/CD pipelines is required.

Certification requirements:
Industry Cloud related certifications
SAFe for Teams Certified

Description
This role will focus on automating and supporting IT infrastructure and application deployment processes and tasks to improve our capabilities and service offerings with greater self-service abilities using infra-as-code principles, DevOps tools and open-source technologies.
What you’ll do:
Ensure Gartner’s enterprise application environments are stable, reliable and secure. Meet and exceed SLA's/OLA's.
Support technology leaders to advance our application platforms and automation pipelines.
Provide and support the tactical and strategic directions for Gartner's cloud and application infrastructure.
Manage and consolidate Gartner’s application deployments to drive down costs.
Provide status reports to the Team Manager, Sr. Director and VP of Application Services in Enterprise Technology and Operations.
Support our security, performance, observability and resiliency frameworks.
Support AppDev teams to ensure delivery of desired business outcomes
Maintain Service Levels and department goals for Incident and Problem resolution.
Support automation efforts across DevOps team utilizing Infrastructure as Code (IaC), micro service-based cloud deployments and CI & CD.
Work on container technologies docker [AKS/EKS/ECS].
Work on Cloud Providers like Azure and Azure.
What you’ll need:
Bachelor degree in computer science, Information Systems, Engineering or related technical field, or equivalent experience
3 to 5 years of Information Technology experience in a public cloud platform and related services [Azure preferred], Kubernetes, automation development, and/or orchestration positions.
Hands-on experience with Azure services (Azure App Services, Azure VM, Function Apps, ADF, Azure CLI, ARM Templates etc.)
Experience with containers, docker, Kubernetes and serverless functions
Experience in deployment pipelines, configuring and maintaining, troubleshooting .NET, IIS, java and open-source application is required
Experience with Infrastructure Configuration and Provisioning tools and concepts (Terraform, Ansible, HashiCorp Packer, Puppet, Chef or similar)
Strong knowledge and understanding of CI/CD processes and DevOps tools (Jenkins, other)
Experience in supporting workloads on Windows and/or Unix (RHEL/CentOS/Ubuntu) is equired
Must have strong scripting experience (python, shell, groovy, powershell etc.)
Experience utilizing tools such as DataDog, Dynatrace, Splunk, or similar is desired
Ability to participate in a rotational on-call support is required
Adept at learning and applying new technologies and solving new problems
Relevant Cloud Certifications is an asset
Who you are:
Passionate about open-source technologies, self-learner who keeps abreast with latest developments.
Passion for automation and developing infrastructure as code.
A team player who can comfortably work with distributed teams across the globe.
Able to work in a highly demanding and result-oriented team environment
Able to solve complex problems and successfully manage ambiguity and unexpected change.
Coachable and embracing of best practices and feedback as a means of continuous improvement
Consistently high achiever marked by perseverance, humility, and a positive outlook in the face of challenges
What we offer:
In addition to an outstanding work environment with rapid advancement potential, Gartner associates enjoy exceptional compensation and benefits, including:
An upbeat, positive culture. Integrity, objectivity, collaboration, results and a no-limits mindset are central to our values
Limitless growth. We work with you to help you meet your goals and advance within the company
Encouragement to be innovative and challenge status quo
Exposure to industry leading training and development
Performance based recognition and rewards
